function.name: list_tasks
function.description: Get tasks for a specific date. Use this to see what tasks exist before making changes. Returns task list with IDs (needed for other operations), content, status (active/done/discarded), scheduled time, and tags. Example: User asks 'what do I have today?' or 'show my tasks for tomorrow'.

date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to today. Example: '2024-03-15'

include_done.description: Include completed tasks in results. Defaults to true.

project_id.description: Optional project ID to list tasks from a specific project.

function.name: get_task
function.description: Get detailed information about a single task by its ID. Use when you need full task details or to verify a task exists before modifying it.

task_id.description: The unique task ID (alphanumeric string like 'kWGw48U_VtUiyIIp_wkEV'). Get IDs from list_tasks or search_tasks.

function.name: create_task
function.description: Create a new task. Use when user wants to add a new task, todo, reminder, or appointment. Parse natural language to extract date/time if mentioned. Example: 'add task buy milk' -> content='buy milk', date=today. 'remind me to call mom tomorrow at 3pm' -> content='call mom', date=tomorrow, time='15:00'. To add tags, first use list_tags to get available tag_ids.

content.description: Task description/content. Keep it concise but descriptive.

date.description: Scheduled date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to today if user doesn't specify.

time.description: Scheduled time in HH:MM 24-hour format. Example: '14:30' for 2:30 PM. Optional.

tag_ids.description: Array of tag IDs to assign. Get available IDs from list_tags first.

estimated_minutes.description: Estimated time for the task in minutes. Example: 30 for half an hour, 120 for 2 hours. Optional.

project_id.description: Optional project ID. If omitted, task is created in active project.

function.name: update_task
function.description: Update an existing task's content, date, time, status, estimated time, or project. Use for editing task text, rescheduling, changing status, or moving between projects. First use list_tasks to find the task_id. For simple status changes, prefer complete_task, discard_task, or reactivate_task instead.

task_id.description: Task ID to update. Get from list_tasks or search_tasks.

date.description: New scheduled date (YYYY-MM-DD). Use move_task for just changing date.

estimated_minutes.description: Estimated time for the task in minutes. Example: 30 for half an hour, 120 for 2 hours.

project_id.description: Target project ID to move the task to.

function.name: complete_task
function.description: Mark a task as completed/done. Use when user says 'done', 'finished', 'completed', 'check off'. Example: 'mark buy milk as done' or 'I finished the report'.

task_id.description: Task ID to mark as completed. Get from list_tasks first.

function.name: discard_task
function.description: Mark a task as discarded/cancelled (not done, but no longer needed). Use when user says 'cancel', 'skip', 'won't do', 'not needed anymore'. Different from delete_task - discarded tasks stay visible but marked as cancelled.

task_id.description: Task ID to discard. Get from list_tasks first.

function.name: reactivate_task
function.description: Reactivate a completed or discarded task back to active status. Use when user wants to 'undo' completion or 'uncancel' a task. Example: 'actually I didn't finish that task' or 'reopen the report task'.

function.name: delete_task
function.description: Move a task to trash (soft delete). Task can be restored later with restore_task. Use when user says 'delete', 'remove', 'trash'. For permanent deletion, use permanently_delete_task.

task_id.description: Task ID to move to trash.

function.name: get_deleted_tasks
function.description: List tasks in trash that can be restored. Use when user asks about deleted tasks or wants to restore something.

limit.description: Maximum tasks to return. Defaults to 20.

project_id.description: Optional project ID to view trash for a specific project.

function.name: restore_task
function.description: Restore a deleted task from trash back to active tasks. Use get_deleted_tasks first to find the task_id.

task_id.description: Task ID to restore from trash.

function.name: permanently_delete_task
function.description: PERMANENTLY delete a task - cannot be undone! Only use when user explicitly confirms permanent deletion. Ask for confirmation before using this.

function.name: add_task_tags
function.description: Add tags to a task for categorization. First use list_tags to see available tags and get their IDs. If needed tag doesn't exist, use create_tag first. Example: 'add work tag to the meeting task'.

task_id.description: Task ID to add tags to.

tag_ids.description: Array of tag IDs to add. Get IDs from list_tags.

function.name: remove_task_tags
function.description: Remove tags from a task. Use list_tasks or get_task first to see which tags the task currently has.

task_id.description: Task ID to remove tags from.

tag_ids.description: Array of tag IDs to remove.

function.name: search_tasks
function.description: Search all tasks by content text. Returns matching tasks across all dates. Use when user wants to find a task but doesn't know the exact date. Example: 'find all tasks about meeting' or 'search for project tasks'.

query.description: Search text to find in task content.

function.name: move_task
function.description: Move/reschedule a task to a different date. Use when user says 'move to', 'reschedule', 'postpone', 'push to tomorrow'. Example: 'move the dentist task to next Monday'.

function.name: move_task_to_project
function.description: Move a task to another project. Use when user asks to transfer a task between projects/branches.

project_id.description: Target project ID. Get IDs from list_projects.

function.name: log_time
function.description: Log time spent on a task. Use when user says 'I spent X minutes/hours on...', 'log time', 'track time'. Supports add (default), subtract, and set operations. Example: 'I spent 45 minutes on the report' or 'remove 10 minutes from task X'.

task_id.description: Task ID to log time for. Get from list_tasks or search_tasks.

minutes.description: Number of minutes to log. Must be a positive number. Example: 30 for half an hour, 120 for 2 hours.

operation.description: How to apply the time: 'add' (default) adds to existing, 'subtract' removes from existing, 'set' replaces existing.

function.name: list_projects
function.description: List all projects with IDs and show which one is currently active. Use before switching, renaming, deleting, or moving tasks between projects.

function.name: create_project
function.description: Create a new project.

function.name: rename_project
function.description: Rename an existing project.

project_id.description: Project ID to rename. Get from list_projects.

function.name: delete_project
function.description: Delete a project (soft delete). Main project cannot be deleted. Ask for confirmation before using this.

project_id.description: Project ID to delete. Get from list_projects.

function.name: switch_project
function.description: Switch active project context.

project_id.description: Project ID to activate. Get from list_projects.

function.name: get_day_summary
function.description: Get a summary overview of a day: task counts, completion progress, time estimates and spent, tags used. Use when user asks 'how's my day?', 'what's my progress?', 'day overview', 'how am I doing today?'.

date.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to today.

project_id.description: Optional project ID to summarize a specific project.

function.name: get_task_attachments
function.description: Get the list of file attachments for a task. Returns file name, type, size, and ID. Use when user asks about files, images, or attachments on a task.

task_id.description: Task ID to get attachments for. Get from list_tasks or search_tasks.

function.name: remove_task_attachment
function.description: Remove a file attachment from a task. Use get_task_attachments first to find the file_id. Ask for confirmation before removing.

task_id.description: Task ID to remove attachment from.

file_id.description: File ID to remove. Get from get_task_attachments.

function.name: list_tags
function.description: Get all available tags with their IDs, names, and colors. ALWAYS call this first before add_task_tags or create_task with tags to get valid tag_ids. Example: User asks 'what tags do I have?' or before assigning tags to a task.

function.name: get_tag
function.description: Get detailed information about a single tag by its ID.

function.name: create_tag
function.description: Create a new tag for categorizing tasks. Use when user wants a new category/label. Example: 'create a tag for work tasks' or 'add a new personal tag'.

name.description: Tag name. Keep it short (1-2 words). Example: 'Work', 'Personal', 'Urgent'.

color.description: Hex color code. Example: '#FF5733' for orange-red. If not specified, a random color is assigned.

function.name: update_tag
function.description: Update an existing tag's name or color. Changes apply to all tasks that have this tag.

tag_id.description: Tag ID to update. Get from list_tags.

function.name: delete_tag
function.description: Delete a tag completely. Automatically removes this tag from all tasks that have it. Ask for confirmation as this affects all tasks with this tag.

tag_id.description: Tag ID to delete. Get from list_tags.
